EACCES.title: Permission Denied
EACCES.description: You don't have permission to access this file or directory
solutions: Try running with sudo (macOS/Linux): sudo quickship build my-app
Check directory permissions: ls -la && chmod 755 .
Change to a directory where you have write permissions
Fix npm permissions: sudo chown -R $USER /usr/local/lib/node_modules
Use npx instead: npx quickship-cli@latest build my-app

EEXIST.title: Directory Already Exists
EEXIST.description: A project with this name already exists in the current directory
solutions: Choose a different project name
Delete the existing directory: rm -rf project-name
Move to a different directory: cd ..
Rename the existing directory: mv old-name new-name
Use a unique project name with timestamp: my-app-$(date +%s)

ENOTFOUND.title: Network Error
ENOTFOUND.description: Unable to connect to the internet or resolve DNS
solutions: Check your internet connection
Try again in a few moments
Check if you're behind a proxy or firewall
Try using a different DNS server
Disable VPN temporarily and try again

ENOENT.title: File or Directory Not Found
ENOENT.description: The specified file or directory does not exist
solutions: Check if the path is correct
Make sure you're in the right directory: pwd
Create the parent directory first: mkdir -p path/to/dir
Check file permissions: ls -la
Verify the file name (case-sensitive on Linux/macOS)

PORT_IN_USE.title: Port Already in Use
PORT_IN_USE.description: The port is already being used by another application
solutions: Kill process using the port: lsof -ti:3000 | xargs kill -9
Use a different port: PORT=3001 npm run dev
Find what's using the port: lsof -i:3000
Restart your computer
Check for other dev servers running

NPM_INSTALL_FAILED.title: Dependency Installation Failed
solutions: Clear npm cache: npm cache clean --force
Delete node_modules and package-lock.json: rm -rf node_modules package-lock.json
Try installing again: npm install
Use a different package manager: pnpm install or yarn install
Check npm registry status: https://status.npmjs.org
Try with --legacy-peer-deps flag: npm install --legacy-peer-deps

GIT_NOT_FOUND.title: Git Not Installed
GIT_NOT_FOUND.description: Git is not installed on your system
solutions: Install Git: https://git-scm.com/downloads
macOS: brew install git
Ubuntu/Debian: sudo apt-get install git
Windows: Download from https://git-scm.com
Skip git initialization: quickship build --no-git

NODE_VERSION.title: Node.js Version Too Old
NODE_VERSION.description: QuickShip CLI requires Node.js 18.0.0 or higher
solutions: Update Node.js: https://nodejs.org
Use nvm: nvm install 22 && nvm use 22
macOS: brew upgrade node
Windows: Download latest from https://nodejs.org
Check current version: node --version

TEMPLATE_CLONE_FAILED.title: Template Download Failed
TEMPLATE_CLONE_FAILED.description: Failed to clone the project template
solutions: Check your internet connection
Try again - it might be a temporary GitHub issue
Check GitHub status: https://www.githubstatus.com
Try with verbose mode: quickship build -v
Report issue: https://github.com/SeifElkadyy/QuickShip-CLI/issues
